annotations.description: There was no time for the supporters to get bored during the game as it was full of action and thrilling moments. Great display from the home side, you have to say that they were the better side today. The home team made a lot of passes and attempted to maintain possession. The away side's tactic was counter attacking.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Santiago Gentiletti (Lazio) lifts the ball into the box from the corner, but one of the defending players gets there first to head it clear.
Santiago Gentiletti (Lazio) strikes the ball towards goal, but it fails to reach the target after being well blocked by one of the defenders. Lazio will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Keisuke Honda (AC Milan) misses a great opportunity to convert the free kick from the edge of the penalty box after firing the ball high over the crossbar of the goal.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Antonio Damato shows the yellow card to Santiago Gentiletti (Lazio) for a heavy challenge. AC Milan earn a free kick which could lead to a goal scoring opportunity.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: 6 min. of stoppage time to be played.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Giacomo Bonaventura (AC Milan) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! Danilo Cataldi provides Ricardo Kishna (Lazio) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort inside the left post. 1:3.

annotations.label: injury
annotations.description: Riccardo Montolivo (AC Milan) is clearly asking for some medical attention with his painful gestures. The extent of his injury is yet to be discovered.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Sinisa Mihajlovic has decided to make a change. Keisuke Honda (AC Milan) replaces Alessio Cerci.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! Giacomo Bonaventura displays great vision and sends a pass to Carlos Bacca (AC Milan), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:3.
Mauricio (Lazio) jumps for a header from the resulting set piece, but it goes way wide of the right post.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Ricardo Kishna (Lazio) will deliver the ball into the penalty box from a corner kick.
Ricardo Kishna (Lazio) sends a pass into the penalty area, but the opponent manages to cut it out. Lazio force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Ricardo Kishna (Lazio) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Dusan Basta (Lazio) has a go from distance but he can't find the target as it goes well wide of the left post.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Substitution. Alessandro Matri (Lazio) on for Sergej Milinkovic Savic.
Senad Lulic (Lazio) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Gianluigi Donnarumma.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: The expression of the referee Antonio Damato is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Alessio Romagnoli (AC Milan) is shown a yellow card.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Giacomo Bonaventura (AC Milan) takes the corner kick and sends a lovely ball into the penalty area, but the opposition's defence is ready and knocks the ball to safety.
Juraj Kucka (AC Milan) produces a poor pass. He attempts to get the ball into the box but it's hacked away. The ball goes out of play. AC Milan are awarded a corner kick.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Alessio Cerci (AC Milan) takes the corner, but the opposition's defence is ready and clears the ball to safety.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Substitution. Antonio Candreva walks off the pitch and Ricardo Kishna (Lazio) comes on as a substitute.
The ball is cleared after Carlos Bacca (AC Milan) attempted to dribble past an opposing player. The referee points to the corner flag and AC Milan will take a corner.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The resulting corner from Antonio Candreva (Lazio) is cleared.
Lucas Biglia (Lazio) whips a promising cross into the box, but the opposition's defence intercepts the ball. The ball goes out of play and Lazio have been awarded a corner kick.
Giacomo Bonaventura (AC Milan) sends in a lofted cross from a mid range free kick, but his poor effort goes out of play.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: A yellow card for a tackle by Dusan Basta (Lazio). Antonio Damato doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. AC Milan are awarded the free kick.
AC Milan hold possession of the ball and display neat passing from player to player. They are waiting for the right moment to open up the opposition's defence to hit them swiftly on the break.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: It's in the back of the net! Giacomo Bonaventura puts the ball on a plate for Philippe Mexes (AC Milan), who has an easy finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 0:2.
Giacomo Bonaventura (AC Milan) is going to send the ball in from the free kick.
Mauricio (Lazio) commits a rough challenge and Antonio Damato blows his whistle for a foul. AC Milan win a free kick and will be able to apply some pressure on the opposition goal.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Alex is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Philippe Mexes (AC Milan).

annotations.label: injury
annotations.description: Alex (AC Milan) is lying on the ground after being tackled and the physio comes onto the pitch to give him medical treatment.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Stefano Pioli makes a half time substitution. Danilo Cataldi (Lazio) comes on in place of Ogenyi Onazi.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The game restarts for the second half.

We have been witnesses to an ordinary game without many breathtaking situations, but there is still time for improvement in the second half. The hosts were superior in their performance in the first half. They were more active and precise. The home side attempts to hold onto the ball for as long as possible, while the away team's main weapon is fast counter attacks.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game is interrupted as Antonio Candreva (Lazio) is flagged offside.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: We will have 1 min. of added time.
The goalkeeper pulls off a great save to deny Felipe Anderson (Lazio), whose good effort would probably have ended inside the right post.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Lucas Biglia (Lazio) works the corner short instead of sending the ball into the penalty area.
Lucas Biglia (Lazio) sends a lofted cross into the penalty area. Unfortunately for him, the opponent's defence deals with his cross comfortably and intercepts it. It will be a corner kick for Lazio.
Alessio Cerci (AC Milan) squanders a great opportunity after striking the ball onto the post!

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The corner from Lucas Biglia (Lazio) is intercepted by the defence.
Antonio Candreva (Lazio) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Lazio.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Sinisa Mihajlovic is forced to make a change. Andrea Bertolacci is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Andrea Poli (AC Milan).

annotations.label: injury
annotations.description: Andrea Bertolacci (AC Milan) picks up an injury.
Lazio keep possession of the ball with some short passes, waiting for the moment to hit the opposition swiftly on the break.
Lucas Biglia (Lazio) is penalised for holding. Antonio Damato signals a set piece.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: A shot is blocked but the rebound lands at the feet of Andrea Bertolacci (AC Milan) who fires the ball into the back of the net.
Alessio Cerci (AC Milan) aims for the middle of the goal, but that's an easy job for the goalkeeper. It will take more than that to test him!

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Lucas Biglia (Lazio) takes the corner and sends it into the penalty area, but the opposition's defence is ready and makes a good clearance.

Antonio Candreva (Lazio) sees an unmarked teammate and attempts to send him a low pass. However, one of the defenders reads the game perfectly and averts the danger. The linesman makes the right call and Lazio will have a corner.

annotations.label: funfact
annotations.description: We can have a look at the statistics now, shots on target are 4:3.
Alessio Cerci (AC Milan) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him.
Antonio Candreva (Lazio) sends a teasing cross into the area, but Gianluigi Donnarumma intercepts the ball.

What a great effort! Giacomo Bonaventura (AC Milan) decides to unleash a long range shot. Despite hitting it very well, it scorches inches over the crossbar. We could have witnessed a magnificent goal.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Alessio Cerci (AC Milan) puts a cross into the box from the corner but there is no panic from the opposition and they easily clear.

Carlos Bacca (AC Milan) produces a quality cross into the box, but the opposition's defence intercepts the ball and spanks it away. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to AC Milan.
Giacomo Bonaventura (AC Milan) commits a rough foul. Antonio Damato stops the game and makes a call.
The foul by Senad Lulic (Lazio) was seen by Antonio Damato who didn't hesitate to blow the whistle.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Lucas Biglia (Lazio) will take the corner.

Lucas Biglia (Lazio) produces an inaccurate low pass into the box that is blocked by the one of the defenders. If this pass had slipped through, the ball would have probably ended up in the back of the net. The ball goes behind for a corner. Lazio will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Giacomo Bonaventura received a sweet pass from Riccardo Montolivo (AC Milan), but the advance is stopped.
Alessio Cerci (AC Milan) is adjudged to have been offside when making his run.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The first half of this match is about to start.
The players are out and the match is about to start. AC Milan will have the kick off.

annotations.label: lineup1
annotations.description: You can have a look at the starting XIs of both teams in the details of this match.

Hello to all football fans, we are here to bring you a live commentary of the following match, describing all the most interesting and important moments. We'll make sure you won't miss a thing, so just sit back and have fun.

There was no time for the supporters to get bored during the game as it was full of action and thrilling moments. Great display from the home side, you have to say that they were the better side today. The home team made a lot of passes and attempted to maintain possession. The away side's tactic was counter attacking.
